Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pixy \Pix"y\, Pixie \Pix"ie\, n.; pl. {Pixies}. [For Pucksy, from Puck.] 1. An old English name for a fairy; an elf. [Written also {picksy}.] [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) A low creeping evergreen plant ({Pyxidanthera barbulata}), with mosslike leaves and little white blossoms, found in New Jersey and southward, where it flowers in earliest spring. [1913 Webster]
{Pixy ring}, a fairy ring or circle. [Prov. Eng.]
{Pixy stool} (Bot.), a toadstool or mushroom. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

pixie n 1: (folklore) fairies that are somewhat mischievous [syn: {elf}, {hob}, {gremlin}, {pixy}, {brownie}, {imp}] 2: creeping evergreen shrub having narrow overlapping leaves and early white star-shaped flowers; of the pine barrens of New Jersey and the Carolinas [syn: {pyxie}, {pixy}, {Pyxidanthera barbulata}]
